meaningMnemonic: Your <kanji>eyebrows</kanji> <kanji>interval</kanji> is that place between your eyebrows called the <vocabulary>brow</vocabulary>. The technical term for this interval between your brows is the <vocabulary>glabella</vocabulary>, but I bet you never use that word. Unless you're... an eyebrow doctor?
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji, but it uses the slightly less common けん reading for 間. Here's a mnemonic to help you remember:

You stare at the beautiful brow on your <reading>Ken</reading> (けん) doll, completely mesmerized. You wish your brow looked as perfectly groomed as his... le sigh~
